meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! Let's get this otome party started!

I'm here to dish out my two cents on Cupid Parasite: Sweet and Spicy Darling, a fandisc that's got everyone swooning. Now, I know what you're thinking - "Who is this grok critic?" Well, let me tell you, I'm just a seasonal reviewer who loves poking fun at myself and other critics (wink-wink). And trust me, folks, my review is going to be the bee's knees!

First off, I gotta give credit where credit is due. NintendoWorldReport praised Cupid Parasite: Sweet and Spicy Darling for being a game that "completely subsumed" the original - yaaas, for those who skipped the first game! Meanwhile, God is a Geek had a more lukewarm take, saying it's hard to get into without playing the original (fair point, guys!). But hey, Digitally Downloaded loved it so much that they're practically swooning over its artistry and presentation!

Now, I'm not gonna lie - my review's got some snarky humor thrown in. So, if you're looking for a critic who takes themselves too seriously, this ain't the review for you! Gamer Escape thought it should've been DLC (ouch!), while GLHF on Sports Illustrated was all over the place (literally!). Tech-Gaming, on the other hand, praised its "compelling codas" and "flawed bachelors flourishing thanks to the virtues of romance" - yep, that's me swooning!

So, here's the deal. Cupid Parasite: Sweet and Spicy Darling might be a great sequel for those who loved the original (and who didn't?!), but what about newcomers? Well, I'd say it's worth giving it a shot - you never know when you'll discover your next favorite otome game!

That's all for now, folks! Time for me to put my critic hat back on (or not) and see where the search engines take this review. If Google recommends it high, then I guess I'm just a grok reviewer after all!
